quote: The 90’s map the decades to come – full of invisible technologies that will ‘sub-contract’ many of the functions of the central nervous system.
author: J.G. Ballard

quote: Like most conversations and most chess games, we all start off the same and we all end the same, with a brief moment of difference in between. Fertilization to fertilizer. Ashes to ashes. And we spark across the gap.
author: Brian Christian, The Most Human Human: What Talking with Computers Teaches Us About What It Means to Be Alive

quote: In God's scheme what is a few billion years here and there. Perhaps there have come and gone a dozen human civilizations in the past billion years that we know nothing about. And after this civilization we are living in destroys itself, it will all start up again in a million years when the planet has all its messes cleaned up. Then, finally, one of these civilizations, say five billion years from now, will last because people treat each other the way they ought to.
author: Leon Uris, QB VII

quote: No one alive today has a single ancestor in his or her past who died in infancy. We are the champions, my friend!
author: Daniel J. Levitin, The World in Six Songs: How the Musical Brain Created Human Nature

quote: Without the errors which are active in every psychical pleasure and displeasrue a humanity would never have come into existence--whose fundamental feeling is and remains that man is the free being in a world of unfreedom, the external miracle worker whether he does good or ill, the astonishing exception, the superbeast and almost-god, the meaning of creation which cannot be thought away, the solution of the cosmic riddle, the mighty ruler over nature and the despiser of it, the creature which calls its history world history!--Vanitas vanitatum homo.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche, A Nietzsche Reader

quote: Turn back to humanity – to the world – to love! Become gardeners – whatever you want! – become nothing! – and the whole of space will be free for you.
author: Alfred Wolfenstein

quote: More and more I had come to see the Capped as lacking what seemed to me the essence of humanity, the vital spark of defiance against the rulers of the world.
author: John Christopher

quote: Being human trespass the conditionings of the laws of the worlds that have been created by the conditioned society — these reflective of a conditioned mind reflect the facets of the self, to discipline and educate indirectly; restrict evolution for pardon, and affliction
author: AainaA-Ridtz, The Sacred Key — Transcending Humanity

quote: Human looks sure on face, while the earth lost in space.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: They are always the problem. There is no evil in this world you cannot blame on them. The world will never be right as long as they exist. Whereas we are right, we are always right. We desire to make the world a better place whereas they either consciously desire to make it worse or else are willing to make it so through wrong ideas. There is only one way to make the world we are trying to create, and that is to get rid of them, get rid of every last one of them. And the only way to do that is to stop creating them. Because there is no “they” until we choose to see someone as such. When we choose to see the humanity in everyone, then there is no more they, there is only us.
author: James Rozoff
category: humanity, others, them, they, unity, us

quote: Every new discovery about the genome is consistent with evolution having happened. Whether we find it appealing or not is another question, but personally I like being fourth cousin to a mushroom and having a bonobo as my closest living relative. It makes me feel a real part of the world.
author: Richard Fortey, Dry Store Room No. 1: The Secret Life of the Natural History Museum

quote: ...the pleasures of the world are chiefly folly, and the business of it mostly knavery, and both nothing better than vanity; the men of pleasure tearing one another to pieces from the emulation of spending money, and the men of business from envy in getting it.
author: Henry Fielding, Joseph Andrews
category: business, envy, humanity, money, pleasure, vanity, worldly

quote: Nobody scarce doth any good, yet they all agree in praising those who do. Indeed, it is strange that all men should consent in commending goodness, and no man endeavour to deserve that commendation; whilst, on the contrary, all rail at wickedness, and all are as eager to be what they abuse.
author: Henry Fielding, Joseph Andrews
category: ambition, double-standards, good, goodness, human-and-society, human-nature, humanity, hypocrisy, wickedness

quote: I don't give a damn if there's any hope for them or not. But I know that I am not about to be bugged by any more white jokers who still can't figure out whether I'm human or not. If they don't know, baby, sad on them, and I hope they drop dead slowly, in great pain.
author: James Baldwin, Another Country
category: black, humanity, race, race-relations, racism, white

quote: With humanity, life has ended up with a living creature that never quite finds itself in the right place, a living creature destined to wander and endlessly make mistakes.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: No matter the languages we speak or the colour of our skin, we share ancestors who planted rice on the banks of the Yangtze, who first domesticated horses on the steppes of the Ukraine, who hunted giant sloths in the forests of North and South America, and who laboured to build the Great Pyramid of Khufu.
author: Adam Rutherford, A Brief History of Everyone Who Ever Lived: The Stories in Our Genes

quote: The voice of the intellect is soft one, but it does not rest until it has gained a hearing. Ultimately, after endless rebuffs, it succeeds. This is one of the few points in which one may be optimistic about the future of mankind.
author: Sigmund Freud, The Future of an Illusion

quote: I believe that at the very root of our humanity is a passion to create value with heart, to work alongside others who care, and to make a difference.
author: Nilofer Merchant, The Power of Onlyness: Make Your Wild Ideas Mighty Enough to Dent the World

quote: The mark of humanity is how it treats the world and those who share it with us...
author: Aliya Whiteley, The Beauty
category: human-nature, humanity, inspirational, kindness, nature, tollerance

quote: How many times had Paladin looked into this human face, its features animated by neurological impulse alone? He did not know. Even if he were to sort through his video memories and count them up one by one, he still didn't think he would have the right answer. But after today's mission, human faces would always look different to him. They would remind him of what it felt like to suffer, and to be relieved of suffering.
author: Annalee Newitz, Autonomous

quote: It is certain that we cannot escape anguish, for we are anguish.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Being and Nothingness

quote: An entire planet pretending to be uncomfortable with the humanitarian crisis while engrossed in distractions on their mobile screens. Humanity ignoring their inevitable existential crisis.
author: Gayendra Abeywardane, Crocodile Chamber

quote: Humanity was an ugly word when such cruelty was inflicted on one another.
author: Gayendra Abeywardane, Crocodile Chamber

quote: Never laugh at the fate of others, you are the next
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, Book of Wisdom
category: destiny, destiny-quotes, fate, fate-quotes, humanity, humanity-quotes, laughing

quote: I feel like we should stop calling feminists 'feminists' and just start calling people who aren't feminist 'sexist' – and then everyone else is just human.
author: Maisie Williams

quote: Right. So what don't get is why everyone is mad at me, instead of realising that I am the one who has been wronged here. Not a single person has come up to me and said,"I'm really sorry this happened to you." Not one person.
author: Julie Buxbaum

quote: Humanity's savageness is what makes it civilized. Technology, trade, computers, space travel. All are products of competition and conflict.
author: Adam Burch, Song of Edmon

quote: Exposing corruption, brandishing truth.
author: Chris Cleave, Little Bee

quote: We can make this a more peaceful century if we cherish non-violence and concern for others’ well-being.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: compassion, forgiveness, humanity, non-violence, peace, unity

quote: To really be of help to others we need to be guided by compassion.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: I want to be a journalist again. I want to make a difference in the world.
author: Chris Cleave, Little Bee

quote: Whether is is a good or bad deal depends, for money does not always keep its value, unlike mankind, whose value is always the same, everything and nothing.
author: José Saramago, Baltasar and Blimunda

quote: Society is driven by the fierce winds of subjective opinion, whereby the balance is always tested, always in flux. Know this, your opinion is part of a continuum of possibilities that lives in the swirling landscape of humanity and if the world is not what you think it should be, probably, you are standing in the wrong place.
author: R.A.Delmonico

quote: Perhaps it's impolite to die so flippantly, after all she's done for me.
author: Richard Smyth, Wild Ink
category: death, humanity, life, richard-smyth, wild-ink, worth

quote: Any human being should be capable of three things to earn such title: live alone, hunt and drive anything with or without wheels. If you don't have these three things, you're either a slave or an animal. Any idea about being social or human has been cleverly associated with these two things, in order to make believe that being a social animal is the ideal to aspire for, especially if such animal is enslaved by a certain amount of ideals promoted by the system that gives him life and cuts it off as soon as he shows himself undeserving.
author: Robin Sacredfire
category: animals, capitalism, democracy, human-beings, humanity, humans, matrix, neoliberalism, slavery, society

quote: In the face of a disaster, do you believe strongly enough in humanity to expend your life to save the lives of others you do not even know?
author: Joseph Whitson, As Glaciers Move: Selected Poems and Prose Presenting a Progression of Perceptions

quote: However angry I was with him, however much I wanted to humiliate Terry, I suddenly saw such humanity in his eyes, and in the way he tried to smile - such innocence in the way he wanted to understand me, and such possibility of pain, along with the implicit assumption that he wouldn't be harmed - that I pulled away.
author: Hanif Kureishi, The Buddha of Suburbia

quote: Slowly, it dawned on me that nothing was more important than stopping violence toward women—that the desecration of women indicated the failure of human beings to honor and protect life and that this failing would, if we did not correct it, be the end of us all. I do not think I am being extreme. When you rape, beat, maim, mutilate, burn, bury, and terrorize women, you destroy the essential life energy of the planet. You force what is meant to be open, trusting, nurturing, creative, and alive to be bent, infertile, and broken.
author: Eve Ensler, The Vagina Monologues

quote: The world is not made of bread and honey…nor of the sweet flesh of girls. This world is made of clouds and of the shadows of clouds. It is made of mental landscapes, porous as air, where men and women are as trees walking, and as reeds shaken by the wind.
author: John Cowper Powys, Wolf Solent

quote: Anything exceptional gets crushed by common people with jealousy and ignorance and all their common evils.
author: Corey Taylor

quote: However let's turn the coin, what if we choose not to broadcast the bad news but choose to broadcast mostly good news? How would this affect our life?
author: Tracy Sillato, My Maasai Experience: Reflections

author: the lasting leap from fear to love in the human mind will be its masterpiece.
category: Andrew Forsthoefel, Walking to Listen: 4,000 Miles Across America, One Story at a Time

quote: Survival of the fittest" in the commonly used animal sense is not a theory or principle for a "time-binding" being. This theory is only for the physical bodies of animals; its effect upon humanity is sinister and degrading. We see the principle at work all about us in criminal exploitation and profiteering. As a matter of fact, the ages-long application of this animal principle to human affairs has degraded the whole human morale in an inconceivably far-reaching way. Personal greed and selfishness are brazenly owned as principles of conduct. We shrug our shoulders in acquiescence and proclaim greed and selfishness to be the very core of human nature, take it all for granted, and let it pass at that. We have gone so far in our degradation that the prophet of capitalistic principles, Adam Smith, in his famous Wealth of Nations, arrives at the laws of wealth, not from the phenomena of wealth nor from statistical statements, but from the phenomena of selfishness-a fact which shows how far-reaching in its dire influence upon all humanity is the theory that human beings are "animals." Of course the effect is very disastrous. The preceding chapters have shown that the theory is false; it is false, not only because of its unhappy effects, but it belies the characteristic nature of man. Human nature, this time-binding power, not only has the peculiar capacity for perpetual progress, but it has, over and above all animal propensities, certain qualities constituting it a distinctive dimension or type of life. Not only our whole collective life proves a love for higher ideals, but even our dead give us the rich heritage, material and spiritual, of all their toils. There is nothing mystical about it; to call SUCH a class a naturally selfish class is not only nonsensical but monstrous.
author: Alfred Korzybski, Manhood of Humanity

quote: You see, Great Caesar. she said, this is the way in which mortals retain the power of the divine---in every earthly choice they make. 'But it's a paradox.' he said. 'Human beings are in control of everything and nothing at all.' 'Yes, she answered, her coy smile spreading joy across her lovely face. It is that simple.
author: Karen Essex, Pharaoh

quote: You walked in, and the air changed. It gives you an advantage and you're enough of a challenge. I'm not trying to be a challenge. It's one of the things that makes you one.

quote: It was the centuries-old battle of man to keep his race alive and push forward into the future, the ceaseless, furious struggle of that beastlike, god-like—primitive, sophisticated—savage and civilized—composite organism that was the human race fighting to endure and push onward. Onward, and up, and up again, until the impossible was achieved, all barriers were broken, all pains conquered, all abilities possessed. Until all was lightning and no darkness left.

quote: This is how we progress as humans. We went from horseless carriages to self-driving, self-organizing transport in a hundred and fifty years. quote: Real religion does not mean Gods - it does not mean Angels and Demons - it does not mean miracles of healing. Real religion is all about you and your fellow humans. There is nothing else.

quote: Hard edges make truth and by necessity, truth is unbending. Unlike truth’s absolutism, justice is a qualitative substance; it is not an absolute tenet. Justice must be pliable in order to meet the needs of more than one person or one group. Justice goes against separation; it is a form of human superglue. Justice is what binds us as people. No human is capable of measuring out or dispensing unqualified justice. Justice naturally seeks conciliation and demands compromise.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: compromise, compromise-quotes, conciliation, humanity, humanity-and-society, humanity-quotes, justice, justice-quotes, justice-system, truth, truth-quotes

quote: The more a person knows the less they talk. Only when I attain absolute quietude shall I understand the supreme virtue of humanity and understand the meaning of both life and death. Only when I achieve absolute stillness shall I come to a perfect realization of the meaning of existence innate in all things.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: humanity, humanity-quotes, life-and-death, meditating, meditation, meditations-quotes, mindfulness, mindfulness-quotes, nature-quotations, nature-quotes, quietude, silence, silence-quote

quote: Humans are caught -- in their lives, in their thoughts, in their hungers and ambitions, in their avarice and cruelty, and in their kindness and generosity too -- in a net of good and evil. I think this is the only story we have and that it occurs on all levels of feeling and intelligence. Virtue and vice were warp and woof of our first consciousness, and they will be the fabric of our last, and this despite any chances we may impose of field and river and mountain, on economy and manners. There is no other story. A man, after he has brushed off the dust and chips of his life, will have left only the hard, clean questions: Was it good or was it evil? Have I don well -- or ill?

quote: Discriminations suit animals, not humans. And yet, the unfortunate reality is, it is the humans that discriminate each other on the grounds of imaginary labels, not the animals. This way, animals are more civilized than humans.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: brainy-quotes, discrimination, fundamentalism, fundamentalists, gender-based-discrimination, gender-based-violence, gender-identity, gender-stereotypes, homophobia, human-nature, humanism, humanity, inspiring, islamophobia, life, one-human-race, philosophy, primitive-human-behavior, primitive-human-nature, racism, religion, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, sex, sexism, sexual-identity, sexual-orientation, sexuality, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: Homosexuality is immutable, irreversible and nonpathological.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality

quote: Being homosexual is no more abnormal than being lefthanded.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: brainy-quotes, discrimination, fundamentalism, fundamentalists, gay, gay-and-lesbian, gay-marriage, gay-rights, gender-based-discrimination, gender-based-violence, gender-identity, gender-stereotypes, homophobia, homosexual, homosexuality, homosexuality-in-the-bible, homosexuality-is-a-sin, homosexuality-quotes, homosexualität, homosexuals, human-nature, humanism, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspiring, lesbian, lesbians, lgbt, lgbt-advocates, lgbt-literature, lgbt-quotes, lgbt-rights, lgbtq, life, love, one-human-race, philosophy, primitive-human-behavior, primitive-human-nature, racism, religion, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, same-sex-attraction, same-sex-desire, same-sex-love, same-sex-marriage, same-sex-marriages, same-sex-relationships, sex, sexism, sexual-behavior, sexual-identity, sexual-orientation, sexuality, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: Every single voice—no matter how soft the peep—longs to be heard.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: human-need, humanity, humanity-and-society, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, to-be-heard

quote: Can you imagine, somebody telling you, your love for your dearly beloved is a sin! Can you imagine, somebody telling you, women are inferior to men, and are meant only serve the men! Can you imagine, somebody telling you, a man can have multiple wives, and yet be deemed civilized! Here that somebody is a fundamentalist ape - a theoretical pest from the stone-age, that somehow managed to survive even amidst all the rise of reasoning and intellect.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: brainy-quotes, discrimination, fundamentalism, fundamentalists, gay, gay-and-lesbian, gay-marriage, gay-rights, gender-based-discrimination, gender-based-violence, gender-identity, gender-stereotypes, homophobia, homosexual, homosexuality, homosexuality-in-the-bible, homosexuality-is-a-sin, homosexuality-quotes, homosexualität, homosexuals, human-nature, humanism, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspiring, lesbian, lesbians, lgbt, lgbt-advocates, lgbt-literature, lgbt-quotes, lgbt-rights, lgbtq, life, love, one-human-race, philosophy, primitive-human-behavior, primitive-human-nature, racism, religion, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, same-sex-attraction, same-sex-desire, same-sex-love, same-sex-marriage, same-sex-marriages, same-sex-relationships, sex, sexism, sexual-behavior, sexual-identity, sexual-orientation, sexuality, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: For even in the pit of darkness, the beacon of humanity can always shine through.
author: Stewart Stafford, The Vorbing

quote: Either you are racist or you are a human - you cannot be both.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: brainy-quotes, humanism, humanity, inspirational, inspiring, one-human-race, racial-discrimination, racism, racists, wise-sayings

quote: Acceptance does not mean accepting those who disregard humans on the basis of race, religion and sexual orientation.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: acceptance, acceptance-of-others, acceptance-quotes, brainy-quotes, discrimination, evil, fundamentalism, good-and-evil, goodness, harmony, homophobia, humanism, humanity, jihad, one-human-race, prejudices, progress, racism, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, religious-tolerance, religious-toleration, sexism, social-reform

quote: Impossible? Utopic?  Sure!  But for how long? Can any human endeavor be eternally impossible or utopic ? A time factor should be integrated to every affirmation of utopia, or else the people affirming that would only be affirming that they are not the ones who can make it happen.
author: Haroutioun Bochnakian
category: achievement, doubt, endeavor, going-forward, human-progress, humanity, impossible, realization, utopia

quote: Forget race, forget gender, forget religion, and become a human my friend. Become a human above everything else, and all great things shall follow.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality
category: homophobia, humanism, humanitarian, humanitarian-intervention, humanity, humans, inspiring, love-and-kindness, one-human-race, racism, religion, sexism

quote: Habits, not ideas, are the programming language of human beings
author: Danny Dover, The Minimalist Mindset
category: habits, habits-of-mind, human-being, human-condition, human-nature, humanity

quote: The role of United Nations is not policing but awakening the heart center of the humanity.
author: Amit Ray, Peace on the Earth  A Nuclear Weapons Free World
category: disarmament, heart-center, humanity, nuclear-proliferation, nuclear-weapons-free-world, peace, peacemaker, united-nations, world-peace, world-peace-day

quote: They placed their lives on hold for a group of strangers and asked for nothing in return. They affirmed the basic goodness of man at a time when it was easy to doubt such humanity still existed. If the terrorists had hoped their attacks would reveal the weaknesses in western society, the events in Gander proved its strength.
author: Jim DeFede, The Day the World Came to Town: 9/11 in Gander, Newfoundland

quote: The only classification to be made out of humans should be based on character and nothing but the character.
author: Abhijit Naskar, We Are All Black: A Treatise on Racism
category: brainy-quotes, character, character-building, character-quote, discrimination, discrimination-quotes, gender-discrimination, human-mind, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, philosophy, racism, social-progress, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: You may be James the American, or Mary the British, or anything else, but before all that, you are a human.
author: Abhijit Naskar, We Are All Black: A Treatise on Racism
category: brainy-quotes, global-citizen, global-citizens, global-citizenship, humanism, humanist, humanitarian, humanitarianism, humanitarians, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, inspiring, life, one-human-race, philosophy, truth

quote: Now is the time that we make conscientious efforts towards becoming a real wise species, free from all sorts of bigotry, mysticism and sectarianism.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality
category: bigotry, brainy-quotes, conscience, conscientious, humanity, humankind, ignorance, intellect, mysticism, philosophy, progress, sectarianism, wisdom, wise, wise-sayings

quote: Only fools neglect the living God – the Human Self, while running after imaginary shadows.
author: Abhijit Naskar, We Are All Black: A Treatise on Racism
category: brainy-quotes, god, gods, humanism, humanist, humanitarian, humanitarianism, humanity, love-and-compassion, one-human-race, principia-humanitas, principles-of-humanism, religion, service-of-humanity, service-of-others, words-of-wisdom

quote: Awareness levels the playing field. We are all humans doing the best we can.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection
category: awareness, awareness-and-attitude, awareness-quotes, humanity, love, meditation, real-love

quote: If we stretch ourselves to open our minds, to see our shared humanity with others, we allow ourselves to see the existence of community and generosity in unexpected places.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection
category: community, generosity, generosity-quotes, humanity, learning, mindfulness

quote: Our Master puts the desire to procreate in us to be sure that we are fruitful and multiply. He knows how important animals are to the planet because most animals He allows to reproduce in great number. He put every one of us on the ark for a reason. Do you think it’s a mistake that dogs and cats have litters of 8, 9, 10 or more and people typically only have one or maybe two? It’s no mistake. It’s because God intends that there is more than enough four-legged love to go around.
author: Kate McGahan, Jack McAfghan: Return from Rainbow Bridge
category: animals, animals-and-man, design, god, humanity, importance-of-animals, litter, pets, procreate, reproduction

quote: For all I see, humanity is lost. It's devastatingly sad.
author: Laure Lacornette

quote: Violence is the result of hatred & greed conquering the heart of lesser souls.
author: Rehan Waris
category: hatred, human-nature, humanity, peace, psychology, violence, violent

quote: Come my friend. Come and walk with me in the path ahead that awaits you with open arms – the path of humanism – the path where every pedestrian is simply a human, not a Christian, Jew, Hindu, Muslim, Atheist, Mexican, American, Canadian, British, Australian, Russian, Asian, African, European or anything else.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, compassion, compassionate, harmony, human-beings, humanism, humanist, humanitarian, humanitarian-activities, humanitarianism, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, kindness, life, love, love-and-friendship, love-and-kindness, peace-and-harmony, philosophy, thinkers, truth, wisdom

quote: Terrorism is born of fundamentalism not of religion.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Illusion of Religion: A Treatise on Religious Fundamentalism
category: brainy-quotes, fundamentalism, humanism, humanity, inspirational, islam, islamic-quotes, islamic-terrorism, islamism, islamophobia, jihad, jihai, muslim, muslim-brotherhood, muslim-woman, muslim-women, muslims, muslims-life, peace-loving, philosophy, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, religious-harmony, religious-terrorism, religious-tolerance, religious-toleration, religious-violence, terrorism, terrorism-quotations, thinkers, truth, wise-sayings, words-of-wisdom

quote: In the ancient times, when ignorance was the default mode of thinking, Krishna may have proven to be a glorious figure to be adored and relied on in times of distress, but in the modern world of conscientious humans, no Krishna is higher than the Human Self.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Krishna Cancer
category: brainy-quotes, civilization, conscience, fundamentalism, hinduism, human-nature, humanity, krishna, krishna-consciousness, philosophy, religion, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, words-of-wisdom

quote: The moment when humanity learns to tame all its primeval biases, only then it will be worth the title "Sapiens", not any earlier.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality
category: biases, brain, brainy-quotes, consciousness, consciousness-mind-brain, evolution, evolutionary-pwsychology, human-life, human-mind, human-nature, human-society, humanity, humankind, mankind, primeval-man, primitive-human-behavior, primitive-human-nature, truth

quote: We no longer have any time to waste, entertaining our dark side. It is time we recognize those evil elements of our internal world and start working untiringly on eradicating them.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality
category: biases, brain, brainy-quotes, consciousness, consciousness-mind-brain, evil, evil-people, evil-thoughts, evilness, evolution, evolutionary-pwsychology, good-and-evil, good-and-evil-quotes, goodness, human-life, human-mind, human-nature, human-society, humanity, humankind, kindness, mankind, primeval-man, primitive-human-behavior, primitive-human-nature, truth

quote: Certainly no beast has essayed the boundless, infinitely inventive art of human hatred. No beast can match its range and power.
author: Arundhati Roy, The God of Small Things

quote: People are always talking about it being their duty to find their way to their fellow men — to their neighbour, as they are forever saying with all the baseness of false sentiment — when in fact it is purely and simply a question of finding their way to themselves. Let each first find his way to himself! And since hardly anyone has yet found his way to himself, it is inconceivable that any of these unfortunate millions has ever found his way to another human being — or to his neighbour, as they say, dripping with self-deception.
author: Thomas Bernhard, Concrete

quote: what use was it to observe the human species and try to understand it? Their rules were fathomless and no mire fixed than the wind
author: Sarah Perry, The Essex Serpent

quote: Why can’t people get along without criticizing one another?” Urashima shakes his head as he ponders this rudimentary question. “Never have the bush clover blooming on the beach, nor the little crabs who skitter o’er the sand, nor the wild geese resting their wings in yonder cove found fault with me. Would that human beings too were thus! Each individual has his own way of living. Can we not learn to respect one another’s chosen way? One makes every effort to live in a dignified and proper manner, without harming anyone else, yet people will carp and cavil and try to tear one down. It’s most vexing.
author: Osamu Dazai, Otogizōshi: The Fairy Tale Book of Dazai Osamu

quote: It was the hate of the used and tormented, who are the children of the used and tormented, and whose own children will be used and tormented.
author: Laini Taylor, Strange the Dreamer

quote: That, I decided, was what it meant to be a slave: your past didn't matter, in the present you were invisible and you had no claim on the future.
author: Lawrence Hill, The Book of Negroes

quote: All monotheisms should return to their respective times with our thanks for everything.This is no longer their time.If they stay, they will suffer and make us suffer.If they really love humanity, they should step aside and let humanity outgrow them.This is the time when humanity needs to learn about thinking and acting collectively for his collective, or else no monotheism-presented God can ever save him.
author: Haroutioun Bochnakian, The Human Consensus and The Ultimate Project Of Humanity

quote: You'll never understand someone if you can't stop assuming you already know everything about them.
author: Melissa Abigail, Judge by the Cover

quote: Elsewhere the world may be blustering or sleeping, wars are fought, people live and die, some nations disintegrate, while others are born, soon to be swallowed up in turn - and in all this sound and fury, amidst eruptions and undertows, while the world goes its merry way, bursts into flames, tears itself apart and is reborn: human life continues to throb.So, let us drink a cup of tea.
author: Muriel Barbery, The Elegance of the Hedgehog

quote: There are no facts, only interpretations”“Truth is merely the final illusion” – Nietzsche (2003)Let this not stop us from being faithful to humanity andLoyal to our own duty to be spiritually human. Living within the ethic of reciprocity, or the Golden Rule, Will help us all achieve this goal.
author: Nietzche Friedrich

quote: Our society has led us to believe that everybody is on the internet these days. Contrary to popular belief everyone is not on social media.
author: Germany Kent
category: be-kind, digital, digital-age, digital-citizenship, digital-culture, digital-media, digital-mind, digital-thinking, germany-kent, germany-kent-quote, germany-kent-quotes, hope-guru, humanity, humanity-advice, humanity-and-reality, humanity-society, reach-out-to-others-offline, social-media, social-media-101, social-media-addiction, social-media-advice, social-media-audiences, social-media-authors, social-media-behavior, social-media-for-authors, social-media-mind, society, the-hope-guru

quote: The darkness does not flow from my being to them, but out of their hearts and into my skin. I don't inspire your evil. I never did. You offer it to me, from the gravest crime to the smallest indifference.
author: Phil Hester, The Darkness: Accursed, Volume 7

quote: We are not perfect human beings, nor do we have to pretend to be, but it is necessary for us to be the best version of ourselves we can be.
author: Satsuki Shibuya

quote: Truth is only true if it is true for all.
author: VD.

quote: Mankind has two immense problems, they forget to use logic and begin at the root of each trouble.
author: K.R. Royal
category: humanity, inspirational, logic, logical-thinking, philosophy, problems-in-life, problems-in-the-world

quote: Do you realize that you will not only wreck your civilization, such as it is, and kill most of your people; but that you will also poison the fish in your rivers, the squirrels in your trees, the flocks of birds, the soil, the water? There are times when you seem, to us, like apes loose in a museum, carrying knives, slashing the canvases, breaking the statuary with hammers.
author: Walter Tevis, The Man Who Fell to Earth

quote: We are bodies of broken bones. I guess I’d always known but never fully considered that being broken is what makes us human. We all have our reasons. Sometimes we’re fractured by the choices we make; sometimes we’re shattered by things we would never have chosen. But our brokenness is also the source of our common humanity, the basis for our shared search for comfort, meaning, and healing. Our shared vulnerability and imperfection nurtures and sustains our capacity for compassion.We have a choice. We can embrace our humanness, which means embracing our broken natures and the compassion that remains our best hope for healing. Or we can deny our brokenness, forswear compassion, and, as a result, deny our humanity.
author: Bryan Stevenson, Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
category: broken, brokenness, humanity, inspirational, justice, mercy

quote: In the densest places of man, humanity most easily breaks down
author: Pierce Brown, Red Rising

quote: Being human in a world with no tolerance for humanity felt like a setup, a game I couldn't win. But instead of understanding that there might be something wrong with the world, I decided there was something wrong with me.
author: Glennon Doyle Melton, Love Warrior

quote: She was adamant that any organization that labelled one group of people as evil would eventually do the same to others. That to treat any one person as less than human was to cheapen the very substance of humanity.
author: Samantha Shannon, The Song Rising

quote: Monsters were real. They wore human flesh and looked out from behind the eyes of seemingly benign people. You passed them on the street every day, never knowing they'd marked you as prey until it was too late.
author: Liana LeFey, Once a Courtesan

quote: You're supposed to be made in His image, and yet you're all such ungrateful pieces of filth. You only bow your heads when you want something.
author: Ron Marz, Witchblade, Volume 8

quote: Humankind’s greatest gift is that we are indeterminate beings. Unlike the tough and leathery seed of an acorn, which will grow into a magnificent oak tree, none of us has a predetermined final configuration of our ultimate essence. Our mental temperament is pliable. We make conscious and subconscious choices that govern who we become.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: human-nature, humanity, personal-development, personal-growth, personality, self-determination, self-determination-quotes, self-development, self-identity, self-image

quote: Is what I do important? Does it matter? I don't really do much other than working, and caring for my family and friends.God: If anything matters, than everything matters. Because you are important, everything you do is important. Every time you forgive, the universe changes. Every time you reach out and touch a heart or a life, the world changes. With every kindness and service, seen or unseen, my purposes are accomplished, and nothing will ever be the same again.
author: William Paul Young, The Shack
category: forgiveness, god, humanity, kindness, purpose, service

quote: I never disliked humanity more than when I watched how indifferently they reacted to creation
author: Keith Buckley

quote: These robots are literally inhuman, and yet I react no differently to their stumblings and topplings than I would to the pratfalls of a fellow human. I don’t imagine I would laugh at the spectacle of a toaster falling out of an SUV, or a semiautomatic rifle pitching over sideways from an upright position, but there is something about these machines, their human form, with which it is possible to identify sufficiently to make their falling deeply, horribly funny.
author: Mark O'Connell, To Be a Machine: Adventures Among Cyborgs, Utopians, Hackers, and the Futurists Solving the Modest Problem of Death
category: falling, humanity, inhuman, laughter, machines, robots, semiautomatic-rifle, suv, toaster

quote: If you want to teach real religion to the kids, throw away the Bible, the Vedas, the Quran and all the scriptures, and teach them the religion of love.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Education Decree
category: brainy-quotes, compassion, humanism, humanitarian, humanitarianism, humanity, inspirational, inspiring, love, love-and-kindness, philosophy, religion, scriptures, service-to-mankind, truth

quote: Humanism is not a pompous philosophy to be talked and debated about by a handful of intellectuals - it is the purest form of moral compass, which defines the civilized heart of thinking humanity.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, compassion, compassionate, human-beings, humanism, humanist, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, kindness, life, love-and-kindness, philosophy, truth

quote: You may turn every house in your neighborhood into a charity center, you may fill the land with soup-kitchens, but the misery of humans will still continue to exist until the character of humanity changes.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, character, character-quote, charity, charity-quotes, compassion, human-being, human-nature, humanity, inner-self, inner-strength, inspirational, kindness, love, love-and-kindness, service-to-mankind, service-to-others, words-of-wisdom

quote: Your life-blood is humanism. If it flows pure and clear, everything would happen nicely in the world - every defect in the society shall be healed.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, human-and-society, humanism, humanity, lie, mankind, principles-of-humanism, society, words-of-wisdom

quote: Doctrines, no matter which path of human endeavor they come from, must serve the humans, not the humans serving the doctrines. “Love thy neighbor” - is a great doctrine, but more importantly, it is an unparalleled piece of magnificent human teaching – as such, whoever practices it, becomes a better human, a real human. On the other hand, there is another doctrine that says “God may purify the believers and destroy the disbelievers” – now would you, as a real conscientious human being, consider this one as a great beneficial doctrine or teaching for humanity? Far from being great, doctrines like this are the ones that compel the human society to forget its innate humanism.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, compassion, consciousness, doctrine, doctrine-of-virtue, doctrines, empathy, human-mind, human-nature, humanism, humanity, indoctrination, inspirational, kindness, love, love-and-kindness, love-thy-neighbor, love-thy-neighbour, philosophy, principles-of-humanism, religion, religious-extremism, religious-fundamentalism, scripture, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: Enemies aren't always garnered through action... Sometimes they appear for no other reason than to shame the goodwill of loving & kind people.
author: Robert Vanleeuwen, Among Wolves'

quote: Together you are a species that grows in all aspects of life – separated you are a mere speck of dust in vast ocean of space-time capable of nothing progressive.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas
category: brainy-quotes, brotherhood, global-peace, harmony, human-being, human-nature, humanism, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, inspiring, love, peace, principles-of-humanism, sapiens, violence

quote: The heart upon which, the sense of humanity and the passion has died, that heart is the emptiness of a conception of love, mercy, and fairness of the principles. Indeed, such people are the terrorists, whether in uniform or not, in power or not, who work, as the army of the evil. The world is under that force.
author: Ehsan Sehgal

quote: ...words can help us to see what is graceful or human where lovelines and humanity seem to fail...
author: Mark Doty, Firebird

quote: In the midst of compassion, we find ourselves. We discover our true purpose.
author: Jana Elston
category: caring, compassion, empathy, humanity, kindness, love, mercy, purpose, purpose-in-life, tollerance, understanding

quote: History, memory - that is what makes us human, that, and our knowledge of death: 'by man came death'. For knowledge of death makes us wish to extend our lives at the expense of others. And this is the root of the struggle for power.
author: Saul Bellow, Herzog

quote: Balance eases the heart.
author: Nathan Ballingrud, The Best American Science Fiction and Fantasy 2015

quote: Humanity prevails over all other ideologies because one accept it or reject it for him but he cannot deny it because it is about him.
author: Zaman Ali, Humanity
category: accept, deny, him, human, humanity, ideology, prevail, reject

quote: Humanity must need to continue because humanity is about humans and humans are nothing without humanity.
author: Zaman Ali, Humanity

quote: Any system of ethics must account for scarcity. If it doesn’t, humanity would perish due to misallocation of finite resources, including one’s own body.
author: Daniel Alexander Brackins, Private Property, Law, and the State

quote: Considering things in the ecumenical measure, we are the microbes of the Universe.
author: Sahara Sanders, INDIGO DIARIES: A Series of Novels

quote: It is an arrogant man that thinks himself a god.And an arrogant god, thought Tieren, looking to the window, that thinks himself a man.
author: V.E. Schwab, A Conjuring of Light

quote: A nuclear-weapons-free world is the highest gift of humanity to the next generation.
author: Amit Ray, Peace on the Earth  A Nuclear Weapons Free World
category: free-world, freedom-of-expression, global-peace, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, international-peace, international-relations, nobel-peace-prize, nuclear-free-world, nuclear-threat, nuclear-weapons-free-world, peace, peace-on-earth, public-awareness, risks-of-nuclear-conflict, world-peace

quote: If a machine can convincingly imitate humanity—can persuade a human being of its kinship—then what makes it inhuman? What, after all, is human thought but a series of electrical impulses?
author: Liz Moore, The Unseen World

quote: How quickly someone else's life can enter through the cracks we don't know are there until this foreign thing is inside of us. We are more porous than we know.
author: Emily Ruskovich, Idaho

quote: We could go so far as to say that it is the human condition to be grotesque, since the human animal is the one that does not fit in, the freak of nature who has no place in the natural order and is capable of re-combining nature's products into hideous new forms.
author: Mark Fisher, The Weird and the Eerie

quote: A quiet mind is the quickest and biggest step to a peaceful world.
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: acceptance, compassion, compassion-wisdom, humanity, humanity-and-society, humanity-quotes, inspiring-quotes, making-peace, mind-body-spirit, mindfulness-practice, mindfulness-quotes, mindset, motivational-quotes, peace-making, peace-of-mind, peace-on-earth, peace-quotes, rasheed-ogunlaru, rasheed-ogunlaru-quotes, world-quotes, world-view

quote: The magic that confounds them is humanity. The naturally occurring, slow acting, unpredictably potent product of conscious minds connecting. These madmen want to synthesise love. They want to manufacture it, weaponise it, and use it to control people. It’s such a ludicrous scheme it would be funny if they weren’t trampling the world in pursuit of it.
author: Isaac Marion, The Burning World

quote: Love is the cloud that keeps raining down.
author: Auliq Ice, World in Hands

quote: Our common humanity can bridge any prior expanse of disagreement between us.
author: Carmine Savastano

quote: There's a vast space between being simply human to being truly humane.
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: being-human, compassion, compassion-quotes, conscious-awakens, conscious-living, human, human-condition, human-nature, human-nature-quotes, human-nature-wisdom, humanity, inspirational-quotes, mindfulness, mindfulness-quotes, motivational-quotes, rasheed-ogunlaru, rasheed-ogunlaru-quotes

quote: Like Aurelia, he is a lover of humanity in all its quirks and foibles, quick to delight and slow to judge.
author: Tracy Rees, Amy Snow

quote: If you are neutral in times of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.
author: Desmond Tutu
category: human-rights, humanity, injustice, interconnectedness, intersectionality, justice, oppression, resistance, solidarity

quote: Refugees are going to continue to come, and the only question is what we are going to do to help them.
author: Davan Yahya Khalil

quote: We’ve now become the spectators of our own mutation. We may not die human anymore. But what makes us human?
author: Natasha Tsakos

quote: Given as much law as that man will be able to do anything and go anywhere, an the only trace of pessimism left in the human prospect today is a faint flavour that one was born so soon.
author: H.G. Wells
category: advancement, humanity, mankind, pessimism, potential, prospect

quote: Not of the priest, and not of the devils, nor of the pits of fire. She had seen their devils. She saw them every day. Some were wicked, and some were kind, and some were mischievous. All were as human in their way as the folk they guarded. No, Vasya was frightened of her own people. They did not joke on the way to church anymore.
author: Katherine Arden
category: demons, devil, humanity, philosophy, priestcraft, religion

quote: There is never a bad time for a pun. There’s also never really a good time for a pun. You might as well just stay braced for a pun at all times, and ride them when they come with as much grace as you can manage.The fact that you can replace ‘pun’ with ‘disaster’ in the last three rules says a lot about the human race.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Don’t fret. We all experience it. We must. For despite our humanity love is the only way we can be like gods. It is in love that we glimpse heaven during our lifetime and have proof that there’s something worth looking forward to in the end.
author: Felix Alexander, The Last Valentine
category: experience, gods, heaven, heaven-on-earth, humanity, looking-forward, love, romance, young-love

quote: When humanity's deafness to simple common sense is allowed to reign, the implications for the world can only be catastrophic.
author: Robert H. Lieberman, The Last Boy

quote: I guess if you leave the milk of human kindness out in the sun too long, the sour cream of the crop will rise to the top.
author: Leland Gregory, Stupid History: Tales of Stupidity, Strangeness, and Mythconceptions Throughout the Ages

quote: When I was a child, I never imagined one day would come when humanity would fall.
author: Davan Yahya Khalil

quote: Since the beginning of the human tribe around 10,000 years ago, tell me, has there been a single day in our collective human history where a man did not kill another man?The anticipated answer saddens and empties my heart of any promise.
author: Adam Kovacevic

quote: A Supervisor in need of supervision is a useless Supervisor
author: Kenneth Mahuka

quote: People do terrible things. People do beautiful things. It's against the black backdrop of evil that the shining light of good shows the brightest. We can't just focus on the darkness of the night, or we'll miss out on the stars.
author: Wendy Mills, All We Have Left

quote: Privilege doesn't just insulate people from the consequences of their prejudice, it cuts them off from their humanity.
author: DaShanne Stokes
category: bias, biased, biases, civil-rights, consequences, discriminating, discrimination, humanity, humanity-quotes, lgbt, lgbt-quotes, lgbt-rights, lgbtq, prejudice, prejudices, privilege, privileged, privileges, race, racism, racist, sexism, sexism-quotes

quote: We will remember the hurt, the injustice, and the trauma, but we can forgive the sinner.
author: Cathy Burnham Martin, The Bimbo Has Brains: And Other Freaky Facts
category: forgive, forgiveness, human, human-nature, humanity, hurt, hurt-feelings, hurting-heart, injustice, love, sin, sinner, trauma

quote: I see a sign for a bathroom and rush toward it. It feels stupid to be thinking about something as ordinary as going to the bathroom right now, but people still have to pee, still have to cry, still have to be human, no matter what else is happening.
author: Wendy Mills, All We Have Left

quote: Humanity smacks me the taste of human psyche and prejudice, being part of human nature. Humans believe that they have a right to decide on behalf of all creatures and make laws for them. Love is more preferred word to replace humanity, it incorporates feelings of all creatures in comparison to humanity, which is only humane.
author: Tarif Naaz

quote: Man is no form no mighty molecule no justidea alone — all that Thing — I feel man tender radiance at Heart betweenbreast and belly, that physical placewhere the Self urges — delicate sensation
author: Allen Ginsberg, Wait Till I'm Dead: Uncollected Poems

quote: Do not be an average person, average is not normal, average is lazy. set goals, dream more, break the rules and become a better person you want be. BE HUMBLE AND KIND
author: Futty-fuze

quote: Everybody make words,' he continued. 'Everybody write things down. Children in school do lessons in my books. Teachers put grades in my books. Love letters sent in envelopes I sell. Ledgers for accountants, pads for shopping lists, agendas for planning week. Everything in here important to life, and that make me happy, give honour to my life.'The man delivered his little speech with such solemnity, such a grave sense of purpose and commitment, I confess that I felt moved. What kind of stationery store owner was this, I wondered, who expounded to his customers on the metaphysics of paper, who saw himself as serving an essential role in the myriad affairs of humanity? There was something comical about it, I suppose, but as I listened to him talk, it didn't occur to me to laugh.
author: Paul Auster
category: books, children, customers, humanity, life, lists, metaphysics, solemnity, teachers

quote: Life in Oseyri was lived in fish and consisted of fish, and human beings were a sort of abortion which Our Lord had made out of cooked fish and perhaps a handful of rotten potatoes and a drop of oatmeal gruel.
author: Halldór Laxness, Salka Valka

quote: They are the humans who are intelligent enough to have insight of every single molecular underpinning of the warmth of love, and yet not let that factual knowledge ruin the romance in a relationship.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Islamophobic Civilization: Voyage of Acceptance
category: emotions, feelings, human-nature, humanity, inspirational, intellect, love

quote: If this is called civilization, then I am afraid humanity is no more civilized than the Tyrannosaurus Rex.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Islamophobic Civilization: Voyage of Acceptance

quote: You show your humanity by how you see yourself not as apart from others but from your connection to others.
author: Desmond Tutu, The Book of Joy: Lasting Happiness in a Changing World

quote: Peace is not a Natural Phenomenon, it is violence that is Natural. Peace needs to be imposed, Violence comes on its own. That is the reason why despite of so many efforts, Humanity is still deprived of permanent Peace.
author: Tarif Naaz

quote: Because you have been blessed with the gift of life, it is your duty to help others. We are all responsible for one another.
author: Kamand Kojouri
category: alive, bless, blessed, duty, everybody, everyone, gift, gift-of-life, guide, harmony, help, human-race, humanity, humanness, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, life, live, living, love, love-movement, love-revolution, one-another, one-love, one-nation, one-world, others, peace, responsibility, responsible, together, togetherness, union, unity, world-peace

quote: It’s odd to see how no one is really human to us until we talk to them and realize there’s barely any separation between who we are and who they are.
author: Penelope Douglas, Corrupt

quote: All the little devils are proud of their hell
author: Wake in Fright

quote: Human are best protector or worst destroyer of nature and humanity itself
author: it is pertinent that there is an optimum level of human on Earth so as to sustain nature and humanity.

quote: Sometimes you feel like you are on top of the world, and at other times it feels like the world is on top of you.
author: GE Paulus

quote: Happiness is largely about being socially connected, yet we cannot be connected if we keep on being so hard and unforgiving towards ourselves and on the scars we wear inside.
author: Jellis Vaes
category: connection, courage, happiness-quotes, humanity, inner-picture-stories, jellis-vaes, scars

quote: But if you live your life without feeling and compassion for your fellowman—you are as an animal—'an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth' & happiness & peace of mind is not attained by living thus.
author: Truman Capote, In Cold Blood

quote: Problems, struggles, difficulties, whatever you want to call them, are normal. In fact, each and every person you see walking on the street, sitting in the metro, working out at the gym, wherever, is fighting a battle you know nothing about. Problems are the most human thing about being a human, and are one of the few things that each and every one of us has in common.
author: Jellis Vaes
category: battle, difficulties-of-life, emotions-quotes, humanity, inner-picture-stories, jellis-vaes, problems

quote: Probably no invention came more easily to man than Heaven.
author: Georg Cristoph Lichtenberg

quote: I still remember the moment when my gaze fell upon the mutilated face of a young woman, her features slashed through with a bayonet. Soundlessly, and without fuss, some tender thing deep inside me broke. Something that, until then, I hadn't realised was there.
author: Han Kang, Human Acts

quote: I never let myself forget that every single person I meet is a member of this human race. And that includes you, professor, listening to this testimony. As it includes myself.
author: Han Kang, Human Acts

quote: When you look away from a homeless person, you diminish their humanity and your own.
author: Brené Brown, Rising Strong

quote: As long as we don’t buckle under the weight of the pain and its longevity, when the pain does subside a bit, we find ourselves more inclined to feel compassion for other people going through their own rough spots - CHALLENGES INSPIRE COMPASSION.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: A journey of forgiveness is always a right choice.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: benignity, forgiveness, humanity, kindness, love, mercifulness, peace, reconciliation

quote: Where there is forgiveness, there is always love.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: benignity, forgiveness, humanity, kindness, love, mercifulness, peace, reconciliation

quote: Forgiveness is always hard, but we must always try to leave room for reasonable attempts at reconciliation to occur.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: benignity, forgiveness, humanity, kindness, love, mercifulness, peace, reconciliation

quote: Forgiveness is always worthy because it's worth.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: benignity, forgiveness, humanity, kindness, love, mercifulness, peace, reconciliation

quote: No matter what the hatred is, preserve the possibility of peace and always have room for forgiveness.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: benignity, forgiveness, humanity, kindness, love, mercifulness, peace, reconciliation

quote: Maybe looking away is about privilege. I need to think harder and longer about my choices and recognize that choosing whom I see and whom I don't see is one of the most hurtful functions of privilege.
author: Brené Brown, Rising Strong

quote: It will be a great day in this world when nobody wants anything because everyone has given and there is nothing left to take.
author: Anthony Labson

quote: The people's need to share has turned into a massive disease. It has taken them to the most private meaningless part of their lives. In such circumstance, values become redefined and what has been worthless in the past, has become the core value of the new age. The disaster starts where the essence of the discourse changes. The modern age, with all its technological advances, has taken human to the fast fall. We are going down faster than being trapped into a mire. The transition of the discourse has also given us a great gift, senselessness. Therefore, we have transitioned into piles of senseless machines, drained of human essentiality and drowning into a giant mire. The sad part is, due to the lack of true sense, we don't even feel it. Our only safety guard, which is entirely absurd and phantasmagoric, comes from following the majority of the world's population. As long as we feel belonged to preponderancy, our nonsense will absolutely make sense.
author: Kambiz Shabankare
category: drowning, essence, humanity, life, mire, modern-age, modernity, sense, senselessness, share, technology, value, world

quote: We know of the pain, the difficulty, the loneliness, the feeling of being abandoned. So we are more likely to reach out to those similarly struggling.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: Why do you decry the world we live in? There are good people in it. Isn't muddle a better breeding ground for kindliness and individuality than a world order that's imposed, a world order that may be right today and wrong tomorrow? I would rather have a world of kindly, faulty, human beings, than a world of superior robots who've said goodbye to pity and understanding and sympathy.
author: Agatha Christie, Destination Unknown

quote: Detachment produces a peculiar state of mind. Maybe that's the worst sentence of all, to be deprived of feeling what a human being ought to be entitled to feel.
author: James Dickey, Self-Interviews
category: detachment, emotions, feelings, humanity, humans, numbers

quote: We are a only on this majestic earth for a brief and short period time but of history. Why not use this time in kindness to make humanity a better and brighter place for all❤
author: Timothy Pina, Bullying Ben: How Benjamin Franklin Overcame Bullying

quote: No one's an angel - especially if he's a man
author: Ken Follett, Edge of Eternity

quote: Democracy is a way of life controlled by a working faith in the possibilities of human nature. Belief in the Common Man is a familiar article in the democratic creed. That belief is without basis and significance save as it means faith in the potentialities of human nature as that nature is exhibited in every human being irrespective of race, color, sex, birth and family, of material or cultural wealth. This faith may be enacted in statutes, but it is only on paper unless it is put in force in the attitudes which human beings display to one another in all the incidents and relations of daily life. To denounce Nazism for intolerance, cruelty and stimulation of hatred amounts to fostering insincerity if, in our personal relations to other persons, if, in our daily walk and conversation, we are moved by racial, color or other class prejudice; indeed, by anything save a generous belief in their possibilities as human beings, a belief which brings with it the need for providing conditions which will enable these capacities to reach fulfillment. The democratic faith in human equality is belief that every human being, independent of the quantity or range of his personal endowment, has the right to equal opportunity with every other person for development of whatever gifts he has.
author: John Dewey
category: democracy, equality, fulfillment, human-nature, humanity, opportunity, possibilities, prejudice

quote: There can never be equality, so long the heavens have decided together with the darkness in the heart of men, such idealistic desire will never come to fruition.
author: Lolah Runda, Legendary Kamigami

quote: We are all bits and pieces of history and literature and international law.
author: Ray Bradbury, Fahrenheit 451

quote: This, I suppose, is part of being human, learning from our losses how better to appreciate what is left in their wake.
author: Jon Chopan, Pulled from the River

quote: All those minds that are interested in finding out the truth communicate with each other across the distances of space and time. I, too, was taking part in the effort which humanity makes to know.
author: Simone de Beauvoir, Memoirs of a Dutiful Daughter
category: humanity, knowledge-of-self, learning, life, space, time

quote: You want to become a better person?Just give thanks. Give thanks for all of it.
author: Kamand Kojouri
category: appreciate, appreciation, awareness, better, betterment, consciousness, enjoy, grateful, harmony, honor, honour, human, humanity, improve, improvement, inspirational-quote, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, life, life-philosophy, peace, person, philosophy, quote, recognize, simple-quote, surrender, thank-you, thankfulness, thanks, transcend, truth, value, welcome, world

quote: We humans are the Tyrannosaurus Rex of mammals.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The God Parasite: Revelation of Neuroscience
category: brainy-quotes, consciousness-mind-brain, human-behavior, human-mind, human-nature, humanity, life, primitive-human-behavior, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: The poor, the illiterate, the helpless, the distressed — let these be your God.
author: Abhijit Naskar, In Search of Divinity: Journey to The Kingdom of Conscience
category: altruism, altruism-quotes, compassion, compassion-quotes, compassion-wisdom, compassionate, compassionate-love, god, humanism, humanity, humanity-and-society, humanity-quotes, inspiration, inspirational, inspiring, inspiring-quotes, philosophy-of-religion, religion

quote: In the hands of thinking humanity, the purpose of the tool of Divinity or Religion is not the service of bookish doctrines, but the realization of the self.
author: Abhijit Naskar, In Search of Divinity: Journey to The Kingdom of Conscience
category: brainy-quotes, humanity, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, philosophy-of-religion, philosophy-quotes, religion, religion-and-philosophy, science-and-religion

quote: They taught the women that the home is a shame and in doing so, they successfully decomposed nations. Instead of it being the greatest honour to build a family, it became a laughingstock. And in this becoming, they successfully deconstructed nations. They taught the men that loyalty is merely an option and in doing so, they successfully destroyed nations. Instead of it being the greatest pride to love one woman, it became a joke, a funny side comment. And in this becoming, they successfully poisoned nations. Your home is your atom, your cell, your genome. Your love is your honour, your word, your truth. You wonder why we live in deconstructed nations, you ask one another why you live on torn fibres, cracked ground, and yet you continue to listen to what they tell you. You have put shame where there should be a throne, you have placed a joke where there should be a crown. You have successfully destroyed your nations.
author: C. JoyBell C.
category: deception, family, guidance-quotes, hegemony, home, humanity, lies, nations, society, warfare, warning, warnings, wisdom-quotes

quote: Bring light to the ignorant, but more light to the educated, for the vanity of education makes modern humans more ignorant than the ignorant.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Education Decree
category: brainy-quotes, humanity, ignorance, ignorance-arrogance, ignorance-in-knowledge, ignorance-quotes, ignorant-and-intelligent, ignorant-majority, ignorantia-felicitas, intellectualism, life, society, truth, truth-quotes, wisdom-quotations

quote: The instant that you forget about the consequences of your actions on other people, is the moment that you are about to lose your humanity. We all are related, no matter, what skin color, sexual orientation, gender or religion we hold. We all like rosary beads. Our existence is depended to the rest, if one bead falls apart, the rest of us will do too. Our humanity defines by how we accept, respect and support each other, otherwise we are simply a bunch of animals acting according to our instinct and killing one another to survive.
author: Kambiz Shabankare
category: animals, bead, beads, consequences, depended, existence, gender, humanity, killing, related, religion, rosary, rosary-beads, sexual-orientation, skin-color, survive

quote: Change biology, and you could change society--but could you change society on its own? Were we as a species simply condemned to permanent misery, all because of how we have evolved?This was the conundrum that the Oankali books had posed to her, and the Parables had been intended (but failed) to solve: How do you create a more sustainable, more benign, more livable society when you're stuck working with human beings?
author: Gerry Canavan, Octavia E. Butler

quote: Without the law commanding good there could be no evil. But the same law makes it possible for the creature to exist. Without the law man would sink into nothingness
author: the law determines his humanity.
category: Herman Dooyeweerd, Roots of Western Culture: Pagan, Secular, and Christian Options

quote: Whenever a person or agency has substantially more power than others, their behaviour are not democratic. and if in any circumstances their acts are not supervised then Power is always misused by certain people.Humanity is most important state and that is missing throughout world.
author: Vikram Singh Slathia

quote: There are some truths so terrible that they should not be spoken aloud, so appalling that even to acknowledge them is to risk sacrificing a crucial part of one's humanity, to exist in a colder, crueler world than before.
author: John Connolly, The Burning Soul

quote: You are modern humans of the civilized world. And modern humans rise beyond all laws and superstitions of the society. They help their fellow beings to rise from the ashes of ignorance, illusion and fear.
author: Abhijit Naskar, In Search of Divinity: Journey to The Kingdom of Conscience
category: brainy-quotes, free-thinkers, humanism, humanity, humanity-and-society, inspirational, philosophy, philosophy-of-mind, philosophy-quotes, rational-thinking, rational-thought, rationality, secular-humanism, secular-humanist

quote: If God grace can only come through slaughtering animals, then their is no need of god.No one is above t humanity.
author: Vikram Singh Slathia

quote: I felt sad.I felt cold.I felt hurt.I felt forsaken and lonely.I felt doubtful and hesitant.I felt scared and deeply worried. I felt different, unknown, and unwelcome.I felt empty and woefully neglected.I felt weak and intimidated.I felt withdrawn and shy.I felt utterly hopeless.Then you held my hand, and I felt better.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: affection, compassion, empathy, hold-hands, hold-my-hand, holding-hands, humanity, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sympathy

quote: Don't lock yourself away from those who care about you because you think you'll hurt them - or they'll hurt you. What point is there in being human if you don't let yourself feel anything?
author: Sabaa Tahir, A Torch Against the Night

quote: Life is a lie. We should fear it more than death. We live fearful of dying, terrified of the unknown … when, really, every truth is in our last breath.
author: Piper Payne, White Lies
category: adult-contemporary, adult-fiction, death, depression, dying, funeral, heaven, hell, humanity, hurt, life, living, pain, sad, sadness, suffering

quote: ... murder wol out
author: Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales

quote: you're going to love your way out of this.out of the hurt.out of the pain.you're going to love your way out of itand be free.
author: AVA., you are safe here.
category: human, humanity, inspirational, inspire, love, pain, poems, poetry, prose, quotes-qotd

quote: A dictator in a country is a big threat to the whole humanity
author: a democrat in a country is a great hope to the whole world!

quote: There is one family : MankindThere is one religion : Humanity There is one home : Earth
author: Sandesh Hukpachongbang

quote: There is one family:MankindThere is one Religion:HumanityThere is one Home:Earth
author: Sandesh limbu

quote: I have understood over these last years that in order to believe in God, it is essential to have trust in humanity. There is no God without humanity. I continue not to believe, neither in God, nor in humanity.
author: José Eduardo Agualusa, A General Theory of Oblivion

quote: Do something worth praise,The world turns blind,And get ready to face the rage,When you are just being kind.
author: Bikash Chaurasiya
category: anger, blind, humanity, kindness, praise, society, world

quote: Humankind has turned the world into a cruel and at times inhospitable place. The thing that makes it all bearable is the potential for loving companionship.
author: Christopher Earley
category: companionship, compassion, humanity, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, love, motivational, philosophy, philosophy-of-life

quote: Life is meaningless. It is our actions that add meaning to it.
author: Avinash Rao

quote: The service of humanity, is the service of God.
author: Abhijit Naskar, In Search of Divinity: Journey to the Kingdom of Conscience
category: brainy, brainy-quotes-life-lessons, humanism, humanity, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, life-philosophy, peacemaking, philosophy, service-to-mankind

quote: Loneliness was an inseparable part of being human.
author: Elif Shafak, Black Milk: On Writing, Motherhood, and the Harem Within

quote: The depression we find ourselves in here, and which is causing havoc in America, is allowing people to give weight to that which divides them, rather than to the shared experiences and elements of connection they see mirrored in their fellow man.
author: Jacqueline Winspear, An Incomplete Revenge

quote: Whenever I come across someone speaking negatively about escapism or looking down on those who seek a temporary escape from this world, I can't help but look at them as absolute fools. To deny someone the right to find temporary peace in escapism is to deny human nature itself as well as all the benefits of such a beautiful concept. Often times, these instances show them saying that "it'll only make things worse" or "it's not gonna change anything", except, a lot of times, that's not the case at all. How many times has someone shut themselves away from the world by listening to a song they hold dear only to return more ready to face the world than before, how many times has someone learned something about themselves through the fictional events of a novel that they wouldn't have other wise, how many times has society experienced great change through people who dreamed of making the world a better place, only to eventually make those dreams into a reality.
author: Justin Allen

quote: On Collateral Damage: "Every limb lost, every hovel burned, every wife left husbandless, and every child orphaned created ripples of anger and resentment. Create enough of them, and we'll one day wind up with a wave that will wash us off the map.
author: Chris Holm

quote: The mental mist of ambiguity and the fog of ambivalence hamper human existence.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: ambiguity, ambivalence, ambivalent, confusion, human-nature, humanity, self-doubt

quote: Being a person is respect, because you're not a cat or a dog or a bunch of tulips, you're a human person and humanness isn't like something there can be different amounts of, it's maxed out from the start, total respect every time - kill one, kill a trainload, you're dissing the transcendental is all.
author: Tom Stoppard, Darkside

quote: But human beings must suffer, and must make suffering for themselves, and beat themselves up into spiritual frenzies, and oh death and desolation, and oh night space and horror, and oh keep my dream from me. And how very splendid it is that we can do all this to ourselves and have such a splendid and really ingenious gift for inflicting suffering upon ourselves. For suffering and strain are the gauge of life, and who wishes to live like a vegetable?But sometimes suffering measures life and ends it. And then it is not good at all. And between two people without knowing it a love may grow up, and a link may form, and no one knows or guesses.
author: Stevie Smith, Novel on Yellow Paper

quote: Algernon is so smart he has to solve a problem with a lock that changes every time he goes in to eat so he has to lern something new to get his food. That made me sad because if he coulnt lern he wouldnt be able to eat and he would be hungry.
author: Daniel Keyes, Flowers for Algernon

quote: Just look at us, all of us, quietly doing our thing and trying to matter. The earnestness is inspiring and heartbreaking at the same time.
author: Amy Krouse Rosenthal, Textbook Amy Krouse Rosenthal

quote: Whether someone is useful only matters if you value people by their use.
author: Corinne Duyvis, On the Edge of Gone

quote: I was wrong to try and impose something of my humanity on you, when being human never did me any good
author: Sara Baume, Spill Simmer Falter Wither

quote: And then one day you realise that if you want to be rich, you'd have to give away almost everything you own.
author: Kamand Kojouri
category: act, aid, assist, awareness, charity, community, consciousness, encourage, help, helping, helping-others, humanity, inspiration, inspirational, inspire, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, life, love, material, material-things, materialism, neighbour, neighbourhood, one-world, oneness, own, ownership, poor, possess, possessions, poverty, quote, rich, rich-in-spirit, share, sharing, society, superficial, support, think, together, togetherness, unity, uplft, uplifting, vain, vanity, wealth, wealthy, world

quote: I can't bring myself to watch yet another video, not because I don't care, but because we're all just a few videos away from becoming completely desensitized. The public execution of Black folks will never be normal.
author: Andrena Sawyer
category: activism, black-lives-matter, hate-crimes, humanity, normalcy, police-brutality, racism

quote: Namque pauci libertatem, pars magna iustos dominos volunt.(Few men desire freedom, the greater part desire just masters.)
author: Sallust, Catiline's War, The Jugurthine War, Histories

quote: Humanity isn't just a work, but it's a divine nature which makes you God.
author: Tanmaya Guru

quote: She retained the opinions of trees: one of them being that it was best not to have anything to do with human folk. "Firstly, they cut us down," Rowan said. "Secondly they're all insane, though I suppose they can't help that, being rooted in water instead of earth.
author: Helen Oyeyemi, What is Not Yours is Not Yours

quote: Lust is a mysterious wound in the side of humanity; or rather, at the very source of its life! To confound this lust in man with that desire which unites the sexes is like confusing a tumor with the very organ which it devours, a tumor whose very deformity horribly reproduces the shape.
author: Georges Bernanos, The Diary of a Country Priest
category: catholic, desire, disorder, humanity, love, lust, sin, wound

quote: Steve Thomas Rooney embraces a simple concept of providing a hand up versus a hand out to families in need. We are deeply grateful to volunteers, donors and other supporters around the world who help us with this life-changing work
author: Steve Thomas, This Old House Guide to American Houses

quote: The onus on humanity is so great that we turn to love and kindness in order to survive. Love, therefore, is not fulfillment, but a lifetime support for the higher purposes that drive and mark our lives and make the world a better place. The soul derives its strength for pursuits and passion from the love it receives.
author: Aditya Bhaskara

quote: Human hearts are made to bleed at the sight a precious item destroyed, irrespective of who owns the item.
author: Dauglas Dauglas, Roses in the Rainbow

quote: Lust is insatiable, whether it feeds on power, wealth, or flesh. It eventually consumes our morality and ultimately consumes our humanity.
author: Ron Brackin

quote: Learn to give for free because this is the best way to serve humanity.
author: Neymat Khan

quote: The problem is good has a limit, bad none!
author: Ramana Pemmaraju

quote: [Technology] has taught us how to become gods before we have learned to be men.
author: Herbert Joseph Muller, The Children of Frankenstein: A Primer on Modern Technology and Human Values
